item.title: Arts and the Economy: The Numbers Show
item.description:
Economic Impact of Nonprofit Arts & Culture Organization

Nonprofit arts and culture organizations are valuable contributors to the business community. They are employers, producers, consumers, and key promoters of their cities and regions. Nonprofit arts and culture organization spending in 2005 was an estimated $63.1 billion. …

item.title: Arts and the Economy: What The Experts Say
item.description:
In my own philanthropy and business endeavors, I have seen the critical role that the arts play in stimulating creativity and in developing vital communities…

– Paul G. Allen, Philantropist and Co-Founder of Microsoft
